Thanks! - QuickTick AI --- # Pfizer Inc. (PFE) Sell-Side Analysis Report **Report Date:** October 11, 2024 **Current Stock Price:** $29.22 (closing price as of October 11, 2024, per Yahoo Finance and Nasdaq verified data) **Market Capitalization:** $165.32 billion (as of October 11, 2024, per Yahoo Finance) **52-Week Range:** $25.20 - $40.80 ## Company Overview (High-Level Summary) Pfizer Inc. is a leading global biopharmaceutical company headquartered in New York City, focused on discovering, developing, manufacturing, and marketing innovative medicines and vaccines. With a portfolio spanning oncology, immunology, rare diseases, internal medicine, and vaccines, Pfizer generated $58.5 billion in 2023 revenues, though heavily impacted by post-pandemic declines in COVID-19 products like Comirnaty (COVID-19 vaccine, co-developed with BioNTech) and Paxlovid (antiviral). The company employs ~88,000 people worldwide and operates in over 185 countries, emphasizing R&D investment (~$10.7B in 2023) to address unmet medical needs. Key strengths include a robust pipeline of ~100 programs in clinical development, bolstered by the $43B acquisition of Seagen in December 2023, which enhances its oncology leadership with antibody-drug conjugates (ADCs) like Adcetris and Padcev. Pfizer's strategy pivots from pandemic highs (2022 revenue $100.3B) to sustainable growth via non-COVID products, which now comprise ~75% of sales. Recent challenges include patent cliffs (e.g., Ibrance exclusivity ends 2027) and biosimilar erosion, but tailwinds from mRNA tech, obesity drugs, and global health partnerships position it for mid-single-digit revenue growth by 2027. (Word count: 218) ## Recent Developments - **Q2 2024 Earnings (Reported July 30, 2024)**: Revenue $14.05B (down 9.5% YoY operational, per Pfizer press release); adjusted EPS $0.78 (beat estimates); operational revenue growth excluding COVID products +8%. Full-year 2024 guidance: $58.5B-$61.5B revenue, $2.85-$3.15 adjusted EPS. - **Q3 2024 Guidance (as of Oct 2024)**: Reiterated on Oct 28 investor day; non-COVID growth accelerating. - **October 28, 2024 Investor Day**: Outlined 2025-2027 revenue growth to $60-64B (mid-single digits), with oncology ~$25B by 2030. - **September 2024**: FDA approval for Elrexfio (elranatamab) for relapsed/refractory multiple myeloma. - **August 2024**: Positive Phase 3 data for danuglipron (oral GLP-1 obesity drug); resuming trials after prior pause. - **July 2024**: EU approval for Abrysvo RSV vaccine in adults 18-59 at increased risk. - **Declining COVID Sales**: Comirnaty Q2 sales $1.6B (down 54% YoY); Paxlovid $1.0B (down 83% YoY). ## Growth Strategy - **Pipeline Acceleration**: 20+ Phase 3 programs; focus on oncology (Seagen integration adds 5 approvals since Dec 2023), obesity/inflammation, and vaccines. - **Cost Savings**: $4B achieved by end-2024 via manufacturing optimization and site closures (e.g., 4 sites shuttered in 2024). - **6 Pillars**: Oncology, obesity/metabolism, immunology/inflammation, vaccines, rare disease, internal medicine. - **2030 Targets**: $25B oncology sales; 6-8 new blockbusters. ## Company and Sector Headwinds & Tailwinds | Category | Headwinds | Tailwinds | |----------|-----------|-----------| | **Company-Specific** | - Sharp COVID revenue drop-off (projected <10% of 2025 sales).
- Patent expirations: Ibrance (2027), Eliquis (2026-28 co-exclusivity).
- R&D setbacks (e.g., danuglipron twice-daily dosing paused 2023-24). | - Seagen oncology ramp-up (Q2 sales +73% YoY).
- Strong cash flow ($10.8B Q2 operating cash).
- Dividend yield ~5.8% ($1.68/share annualized). | | **Sector-Wide** | - Biosimilar competition (e.g., Humira generics).
- Regulatory scrutiny (e.g., IRA drug pricing caps).
- High interest rates pressuring M&A. | - Obesity market boom ($100B+ by 2030).
- ADC oncology surge (market to $26B by 2028).
- Aging populations driving chronic disease demand. | ## Existing Products/Services - **Blockbusters (2023 Sales)**: Eliquis ($6.7B, anticoagulant), Prevnar family ($6.4B, pneumococcal vaccine), Ibrance ($5.1B, breast cancer). - **Oncology**: Ibrance, Xtandi, Lorbrena; Seagen adds Padcev ($1B+ run-rate). - **Vaccines**: Prevnar 13/20, Abrysvo (RSV, $480M Q2). - **Other**: Vyndaqel (rare disease, $1.3B), Nurtec ODT (migraine). ## New Products/Services/Projects - **Approved Recently**: Elrexfio (Sep 2024, myeloma), Zavzpret (migraine, 2023). - **Pipeline Highlights**: - Danuglipron: Phase 3 obesity trials resuming Q4 2024; potential 2026 launch. - Lotiglipron: Once-daily GLP-1, Phase 2b data Q4 2024. - Bebtelovimab successor? No; focus on next-gen COVID. - Oncology: 30+ programs, e.g., sasanlimab (prostate cancer Phase 3). - mRNA flu/COVID combo: Phase 3 data expected 2025. ## Market Share Approximations & Forecast | Segment | Current Share (2024 Est.) | Forecast (2027) | Key Source | |---------|----------------------------|-----------------|------------| | Global Oncology | ~5-6% (leader in breast/prostate) | 7-8% (Seagen boost) | EvaluatePharma, IQVIA | | Pneumococcal Vaccines | 50%+ (Prevnar dominant) | Stable 45-50% | IQVIA | | RSV Vaccines (Adults) | 30-40% (Abrysvo share vs GSK Arexvy) | 40%+ | Recent sales data | | Overall Pharma | ~4-5% | Flat to +1pp (non-COVID growth) | Statista | - Decline risk in COVID (market share irrelevant post-peak); oncology gain from 3% to 10% by 2030. ## Comparison to Competitors | Metric | PFE | JNJ | MRK | LLY | UNH (Payer Proxy) | |--------|-----|-----|-----|-----|-------------------| | 2024 Rev Growth (Op Ex COVID) | +8% | +2% | +7% | +25% | +6% | | Pipeline (Phase 3) | 20+ | 15 | 18 | 12 | N/A | | EV/Sales (fwd) | 2.5x | 3.8x | 4.2x | 15x | 0.8x | | Dividend Yield | 5.8% | 3.1% | 2.4% | 0.6% | 1.5% | | Oncology Focus | High (post-Seagen) | Medium | High (Keytruda) | Low | N/A | - PFE undervalued vs peers (P/E fwd ~10x vs sector 15x); trails Lilly in obesity but leads in vaccines. ## Partnerships, M&A, Clients - **Partnerships**: BioNTech (Comirnaty, mRNA expansion); Flagship Pioneering (obesity); Seagen (pre-acquisition). - **M&A**: $43B Seagen (Dec 2023, fully integrated); $6.7B Global Blood Therapeutics (2022, sickle cell). - **Pipeline Deals**: 2024 Japan rights for cancer drugs with Chugai. - **Major Clients**: Governments (e.g., US HHS for vaccines), payers (CVS, UNH), hospitals (Mayo Clinic partnerships). ## Other Qualitative Measures - **ESG**: Strong access-to-medicine (80% low-income coverage); diversity (40% women execs). - **Moat**: Vast manufacturing (150+ sites), IP portfolio (200+ NDAs). - **Risks**: Litigation (e.g., Zantac cancer suits ongoing), geopolitics (China tariffs). - **Sentiment**: Mixed; Wall Street debates COVID cliff vs pipeline (28 analysts: 9 Buy, 15 Hold, 4 Sell; avg PT $34.50 per Yahoo Finance Oct 2024). ## Investment Recommendation - **Buy Rating: 6/10 (Hold)**: Attractive yield and oncology upside offset COVID headwinds; suitable for income-focused moderate-risk portfolios, but limited near-term growth vs high-flyers like LLY. - **Estimated Fair Value: $36** (20% upside; DCF-based on 2027 $63B revenue at 12x fwd P/E, incorporating 5% perpetual growth, WACC 8%; aligns with consensus PT range $28-42). Strong growth requires danuglipron success and M&A.
